Package algorithms.imageProcessing

Class Image

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.Image
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageExt, Rectification.RectifiedImage
public class Image extends Object
space conserving image data holder. NOTE, because of internal pixel indexing, the size of this image is limited to 46340 pixels in width and height.
Author:
nichole

    void
    debugPrint()
     
    List<double[][]>
    exportColMajor()
    export red, blue and green frames to 1 double[][] each, in format col major, that is red[i][j] is red[x][y] where x and y are the pixel coordinates.
    List<double[][]>
    exportRowMajor()
    export red, blue and green frames to 1 double[][] each, in format row major, that is red[i][j] is red[y][x] where x and y are the pixel coordinates.
    void
    fill(int red, int green, int blue)
    convenience method to fill image with the red, reen, and blue values which are between 0 and 255 inclusive.

    getRow(int internalIndex)

    protected int
    getRowNumber(int pixelIdx)
    given the pixel index which is a number representing (row * width) + col for an uncondensed array, return the internal array element index (for example the index for the r array holding the value for pixelIdx would be at r[elementIdx] which itself holds 4 values on a 32 bit system or 8 on a 64 bit system.

  • Method Details

    • init

      protected void init()

    • getRowNumber

      protected int getRowNumber(int pixelIdx)
      given the pixel index which is a number representing (row * width) + col for an uncondensed array, return the internal array element index (for example the index for the r array holding the value for pixelIdx would be at r[elementIdx] which itself holds 4 values on a 32 bit system or 8 on a 64 bit system.
      Parameters:
      pixelIdx -
      Returns:

    • getInternalIndex

      Parameters:

      row -
      Returns:

    • fill

      public void fill(int red, int green, int blue)
      convenience method to fill image with the red, reen, and blue values which are between 0 and 255 inclusive.
      Parameters:
      red - value for red in range 0 to 255, inclusive
      green - value for green in range 0 to 255, inclusive
      blue - value for blue in range 0 to 255, inclusive

    • exportColMajor

      public List<double[][]> exportColMajor()
      export red, blue and green frames to 1 double[][] each, in format col major, that is red[i][j] is red[x][y] where x and y are the pixel coordinates.
      Returns:

    • exportRowMajor

      public List<double[][]> exportRowMajor()
      export red, blue and green frames to 1 double[][] each, in format row major, that is red[i][j] is red[y][x] where x and y are the pixel coordinates.
      Returns:
